ratings.comment: Tough grader,wouldnt recommend.Worst grader i had in college.
She is a nice prof and patient to students but her grading is wayyyyyyy tooooooo tough than we should get and I don't understand why we did such a good job but only got like B or BC
Somewhat difficult grades and the presentations are annoying but very nice person and always willing to help.
Efforts never paid off.  Grading is not quite fair and you never know what she is expecting. Assignment schedule is clear though.
Pretty easy class, didn't have many assignments but when you do they're large. Seems easy to pull a B but difficult to get an A
She is pretty good. Class is way harder than what a 2 credit Comm A class should be. I honestly would have rather taken Comm A 100. I recommend the prof but not the class

Cindy is really great. Class is easy if you just listen to her in class and do what she tells you to in class. Overall very passionate. Class can get boring and there are some pointless assignments, but it is impossible to get lower than a B with with cindy and an A is easily attainable.

As someone who doesn't have natural speaking talents, this class was difficult to do well in. She increases the grading standards with each speech, so effort and improvements throughout the semester don't really improve your grade. However, people who are naturally good public speakers could get high grades with very little effort.
The class sucked and was incredibly boring but she made it just about as easy as she could. I don't think it was even possible to get lower than a B on a presentation.

If you have a chance of taking EPD 397 with Poe, YOU TAKE IT!! She's super easy, super chill and very lenient. She can spot out slackers easily and will make it difficult for you if you don't do the work. Just show her that you're making an effort and doing what she wants you to do, you'll get an A/AB. She's the easiest EPD397 professor, SO TAKE IT

She handed out a 24 page single spaced syllabus at the beginning of the semester. WHAT? It has everything, homework, guidelines, and all. If you ask her about the assignments she'll just refer to it. She's able to teach engineers but I didn't find her helpful when it came to asking about written work. She plans great presentation assignments though

She understands that we are engineers, not english majors and grades very fair. This class is a lot of work for only 3 credits but it does help with writing/presenting skills. Talk with her after class/in office hours, she will help you a lot with your projects. I recommend taking this class with her.

She grades pretty easily so if you did well in english in high school, you should get at least a B. Since it's an english class for engineers, she kind of assumes everyone is stupid.  Some assignments in class are pointless though.
Semi tough, good professor, always willing to help out of class if you are struggling.
